rules.title: Heavy Armoured Vehicle (H-AV)
description: Units with the unit type H-AV can take two damage before they are killed, and counts as two units for Outnumber, Blast Markers, number of attacks in an assault, hit allocation and the maximum number of units in base contact. H-AV are treated as WE when hit by weapons that do multiple points of damage (e.g. TK(D3)). In addition it is possible to critically hit H-AVs. If a Critical Hit is rolled, the unit is destroyed with no further effects. H-AVs are treated like normal Armoured Vehicles in all other respects.

rules.title: Machine Spirit
description: A formation that exclusively consists of units with Machine Spirit may only perform the Hold, Engage, Marshal, Sustained Fire and Overwatch actions. In addition, such formations may only contest objectives, and always counts as being within 30cm of an enemy formation when attempting to Rally.

rules.title: Rubric of Ahriman
description: Any formation with at least one unit with Rubic of Ahriman that contain no Sorcerer or Daemon Prince may only perform the Hold, Engage, Marshal, Sustained Fire and Overwatch actions.

rules.title: Void Shields
description: Void shields that have been knocked down can be repaired. Each War Engine can repair one downed Void Shield in the End Phase of each turn.

In addition, if a War Engine regroups (either by performing a Hold or a Marshal action) it can use the dice roll both to repair Void Shields and remove Blast Markers. However, only half the points generated (fractions rounded up) may be spent on restoring Void Shields (e.g. if you rolled a 3 you could remove three Blast Markers, or repair two Void Shields and remove one Blast Marker).

rules.title: God Machine
description: War Engines with 8 or more DC are subject to the God Machine and Split Fire special rules.

The magnificence of these awe-inspiring constructs comes at a price, for if such an incarnation of power were to falter or be destroyed, the forces that are there to aid them would become greatly disturbed.

For this reason, whenever a unit with God Machine special rule is broken (including if it is already broken but loses an Engage), all friendly formations suffer one Blast Marker. Whenever a unit with God Machine special rule is destroyed, all friendly formations on the battlefield suffer D3 Blast Markers.
Units with the God Machine special rule are themselves immune to this effect.

rules.title: Split Fire
description: A War Engine with this special rule may declare that it will Split Fire when attempting to perform a Sustain Fire or Advance Action. If the activation is successful, the WE may fire at up to two enemy formations, but may not target more than one formation per individual weapon. If Split Fire is performed, the WE gets no +1 modifier for Sustain Fire, and suffers a -1 modifier for doing an Advance.

rules.title: Adeptus Custodians
description: Adeptus Custodian are renowned for their tenacity and bravery. This is represented by the following rules:
* It takes 2 Blast Markers to suppress a Adeptus Custodian unit.
* Adeptus Custodian formations are only broken if they have 2 Blast Markers per unit in the formation.

* Adeptus Custodian formations only count half their number of Blaster markers in assault resolution (rounding down—note that assault resolution will not receive +1 for having no Blast Markers if the formation has 1 Blast Marker before rounding down).

* When a broken Adeptus Custodian formation rallies, it receives a number of Blast Markers equal to the number of units, rather than half this number. Adeptus Custodians with the Leader special ability remove 2 Blast Markers instead of 1

* All Adeptus Custodian units are consider fearless in all respects except they still have to end their move while broken outside of 15cm of an enemy foramtion. If they cant they are subject to standard hackdowns rules for broken non fearless units with in 15cm of a enemy unit taking into account the above rules for Adeptus Custodians and Blast Markers.

rules.title: Support Craft
description: Support Craft are Skimmers, which for all line of sight and terrain purposes count as ‘popped up’ at all times. If the Support Craft has a transport option, it may embark and disembark units as normal. Embarked units are allowed a save (see 1.7.5) if the Support Craft is destroyed.

Support Craft do not block line of sight, must always use their Skimmer ability to force a firefight in engagements and Infantry in base contact with a Support Craft may not use it to count as being in cover.

rules.title: Indomitable
description: All Squat formations ignores the -1 modifier for enemy formations within 30cm when rallying (does not apply to formations that exclusively consists of units with the 'Machine Spirit' special rule).

rules.title: Spirit Lords
description: A formation with a Living Ancestor does not suffer a -1 modifier to their Action Test when attempting to retain the initiative.

rules.title: Tunneling Transports
description: Formations including units with both the Transport and Tunneler special rules must start the game in the reserves, and may only enter the battlefield through tunneling. War Engines with these special rules may not start the game empty, but must transport another formation.

rules.title: Shield Disruptor
description: Each point of damage from a hit with Shield Disruptor will knock down two Powerfields, Shadowfields or Void Shields (if only one remains it is knocked down, but the hit does not carry over). In addition, Shield Disruptor hits ignores Deflector Shields and Ion Shields.

rules.title: Bravery
description: All Knight formations receive a +1 modifier to their Action Test when carrying out an Engage action, and a +1 modifier to their Rally Tests.

rules.title: Stubborn
description: Any formation where at least one unit has Stubborn reduce the damage caused by Blast Markers while the formation is broken by one, reduce the number of extra hits from losing an assault by one, requires an additional Blast Marker before the formation becomes broken, and may ignore one Blast Marker when determining suppression.

rules.title: Ion Shield (x)
description: Knights make use of Ion Shields to deflect shooting attacks. This allows them to make a saving throw on the number within brackets when they are hit by ranged fire instead of using their armour value.

No modifiers ever apply to this saving throw and it is unaffected by Macro-Weapon, Lance and Titan Killer hits (each point of damage from a Titan Killer hit must be saved separately. Is affected normally by hits with the Disrupt special rule). If the unit has Reinforced Armour as well then it is allowed to re-roll a failed save using its armour value unless the hit was a Macro-Weapon, Lance or Titan killer.

None of these benefits apply to units in a crossfire, hits from supporting fire, or CC attacks (the Ion Shield save can still be used against FF attacks. If relevant, roll CC and FF dice separately when attacking units equipped with Ion Shields).

rules.title: Ionic Flare Shield
description: Knights with 'Ionic Flare Shield' may also use their Ion Shield against CC attacks.

rules.title: Shield Piercer
description: Weapons with the 'Shield Piercer' special rule ignores Deflector Shields, Ion Shields, Powerfields, Shadowfields and Void Shields (Shadowfields still provide cover from shooting).

rules.title: Psybolts
description: Weapons with the 'Psybolts' special rule ignores Powerfields, Shadowfields, Void Shields, Deflector Shields, Ion Shields and Invulnerable Saves (Shadowfields still provide cover from shooting).

rules.title: Lightning Charge
description: Weapon gains First Strike when the wielder's formation initiated the Engage.

rules.title: Unstable
description: If a natural 1 is rolled when rolling to hit, roll another dice. If the result is yet another natural 1, the wielder is destroyed.

rules.title: Courage, Discipline and Loyalty
description: When the Supreme Commander re-roll is used on a formation that contains a Commissar or a Ministorum Priest, the formation counts as having 1+ Initiative Rating when re-rolling the Action Test.

rules.title: Grim Demeanour
description: Valhallan formations that contain a Ministorum Priest gain +1 on their Action Test when attempting to Marshal.

rules.title: Grav-Chutes
description: Units with the 'Grav-Chutes' special rule may disembark up to 10cm from Skimmer transport vehicles instead of the normal 5cm.

rules.title: Ethereal
description: All units in a formation joined by an Ethereal gain Fearless. When the unit with the Ethereal is killed the formation loses Fearless and receives 1D3 Blast Markers.

rules.title: Blitzkrieg
description: Formations containing a unit with the Blitzkrieg ability receive a +1 modifier to their Action Test when attempting to Double.

rules.title: Catachan Commanders
description: When the Supreme Commander re-roll is used on any formation containing a Catachan Supreme Commander or Catachan Commander, the formation counts as having 1+ Initiative Rating when re-rolling the Action Test

rules.title: Fortified Positions
description: Fortified Positions (except Gun Emplacements) must be set up after objectives have been placed but before spacecraft and garrisons are set up.

Each group of Fortified Positions (bought as a collective, or bought as part of a formation) are set up as if it was a formation garrisoning (at least one piece within 15cm of an objective in the friendly half of the table, may only be placed in the friendly half of the table). If more than one player has Fortified Positions, alternate placements as when garrisoning formations. Each individual group of Fortified Positions (whether part of a formation or not) must be set up within coherency of another piece from the same group, so all pieces from the same group form a “chain” without any gaps larger than 5cm.
Units of INF that benefit from Cover inside a Fortified Position may only be Barged by WE in such a way that they are not moved outside of their Fortified Position.
Once set up, Fortified Positions counts as terrain that do not block Line of Sight, and may be used by either side.
Gun Emplacement: Provides a Cover Save of 4+ one unit of INF, or a 5+ Cover Save to one unit of AV or LV (but not H-AV).

Gun Emplacements are not set up with other Fortified Positions, but are instead set up at the same time as the rest of the formation that they were bought with. Each unit in such a formation must be set up inside an available Gun Emplacement, following the normal formation coherency rules.
Bunker: Provides a Cover Save of 3+ and Thick Rear Armour to up to three units of INF. Counts as Dangerous Terrain for AV and WE.
Trench: Provides a cover save of 4+ to INF. May contain one unit of INF per 4cm of lenght. Counts as Dangerous Terrain for AV.

Razor Wire: Counts as Dangerous Terrain for all INF, including those that have the Mounted special rule. Razor Wire dangerous terrain tests may not be re-rolled using the Walker ability (units may still 'move carefully' through such terrain). Razor Wire must be set up so that every piece touches another piece from the same group, with no gap in between.

Minefields: Counts as Dangerous Terrain for all types of units. Minefield dangerous terrain tests may not be re-rolled using the Walker ability (units may still 'move carefully' through such terrain). Skimmers and units with 'Jump Packs' moving over Minefields must also take dangerous terrain tests. Minefields must be set up so that every piece touches another piece from the same group, with no gap in between.

rules.title: Baran Regimental HQ
description: When playing Epic tournament games, a Siegemaster army must include a Regimental HQ. The enemy counts as having achieved the “Break Their Spirit” goal by destroying this formation or by destroying the most expensive formation in the army (see Victory Conditions).

rules.title: Vertical Envelopment
description: Up to three formations that garrison may start on Overwatch instead of the usual two. In addition, one aircraft formation may start the game on CAP. The aircraft formation will follow all the rules for CAP, but is setup during the pre-game garrisoning phase.

rules.title: Sky Talons
description: The Elysian Drop Troops garrisons only need to have one unit within 30cm from an objective instead of the usual 15cm.

rules.title: Siege Specialists
description: Friendly units may re-roll failed dangerous terrain tests when making a move through Minefields or Razor Wire on the friendly part of the table, and friendly units with 'Walker' may use it against enemy Minefields or Razor Wire.
In addition, up to three formations that garrison may start on Overwatch instead of the usual two.

rules.title: Tunnelers
description: Tunnellers may be set up touching their own side's table edge before the battle starts at the same time that spacecraft are set up (see 4.3.1). Any units transported in tunnellers should be placed to one side at this time too. Secretly write down the location where the tunneller will surface at the same time and in the same manner that you record the coordinates of a drop zone (see 4.3.1). You must also secretly record the turn the tunneller will surface. If it is going to surface in your half of the table it may arrive from the second turn onwards. If it is going to surface in the opposing half of the table, it may arrive from turn three onwards.

Set up the tunneller units at the start of the stated turn, before determining who wins the strategy roll, at the location you wrote down. Surfacing does not count as movement for the purposes of triggering enemy overwatch fire. If a tunneller would have surfaced on terrain that is impassable for it, under a friendly unit, or in an enemy zone of control, then it is assumed that on-board sensor equipment would divert it towards another entry point. The unit should be moved to the nearest area where it can surface.

Formations of multiple tunnellers need only record one location where they will surface. Place the first tunneller unit at this location. All other tunneller units must be placed within 5cm of another tunneller unit that has already been placed and fully within a 15cm radius of the original surfacing coordinates. After all tunnellers have been placed any units being transported are allowed to disembark immediately.
Disembarking triggers overwatch fire as normal. Tunnellers, and any units being transported in them, may take an action on the turn they appear.

rules.title: Self Planetfall
description: Self Planetfall is plotted exactly as planetfall (see 4.4). Both the turn in which the formation arrives and the landing location is plotted. The only exception is that, because these units are much smaller than orbiting spacecraft, they may be plotted to arrive in the same turn that another spacecraft is present. On the designated turn the formation conducting Self Planetfall is activated in the normal activation sequence, as with spacecraft. Nominate the action for the formation and roll to activate. If the formation fails to activate its arrival is delayed to the next following turn. If the activation is successful, place the formation at the plotted landing zone and determine scatter according to 4.4 as if it were a normal planetfall, including loaded units disembarking up to 5cm. The formation’s action proceeds as normal in all respects from that point. In other words, the formation gets the “free move” from planetfall placement at the beginning of its action but in all other ways activates as normal. Note: The action is chosen at activation, before scatter is determined. Choose the action carefully as a poor scatter roll could render some actions ineffective.

rules.title: Act of Faith
description: When successfully performing an Engage action, units that have the 'Faithful' special rule gain Fearless. In addition, all units in a formation that contain at least one unit with 'Faithful' gain Invulnerable Save. Units that already have an Invulnerable Save gain a 5+ Invulnerable Save instead. These effects last until the end of the current turn.

rules.title: Cult of the Machine
description: If a friendly Titan or an Iron Hands Venerable Dreadnought is destroyed, all formations within 30cm suffer one Blast Marker marking the deep loss it represents to the chapter.

rules.title: Bionics
description: The extensive bionic modifications undergone by the Iron Hands and the Iron Warriors increases their resistance to physical trauma. Characters with the Bionics special rule increases the Armour of their unit to 3+ when added to a unit of INF.

rules.title: Battlefield Repairs
description: As long as a formation contains a unit with the 'Battlefield Repairs' special ability, all Armoured Vehicle units in the formation gains Invulnerable Save.

rules.title: Extended Command
description: Formations with at least one unit with the 'Extended Command' ability extend the range at which Commanders within the formation can call other formations to follow them when they make a combined assault from 5cm to 10cm (see 2.1.2).

rules.title: Space Marine Transports
description: The Space Marines are a highly mobile army. Because of this, the points cost of a detachment usually includes enough Rhino transport vehicles to transport it and any upgrades that have been taken. Determine the number of Rhinos needed after all upgrades have been purchased. The number of Rhinos will always be the minimum needed to carry the formation, you can’t take extras along to cover any losses!

Note that many formations don’t receive Rhinos, usually because they can’t fit into them. Detachments that come with Rhinos will be noted as having plus transport in the units section of the army list opposite.

Also note that you don’t have to take Rhinos if you don’t want to. If you’d rather field the formation on foot instead, so it can act as a garrison for example, or be transported in a Thunderhawk, then you may do so.

In addition, you may choose to replace a detachment’s Rhinos with Drop Pods. If you do this then the detachment will enter play in a Drop Pod using the rules for Planetfall (see Planetfall). Note that if you choose to do this you will also require a Space Marine Strike Cruiser or Battle Barge to deploy the Drop Pods from.

Before each game, after the opposing army is known but before objectives are placed, the Space Marine player may choose which formations with the plus transport aspect are deployed in Rhinos, Drop Pods or on foot. If the formation has any units unable to deploy in Drop Pods then that option cannot be selected.

rules.title: Grey Knights Transports
description: Grey Knights formations with 'plus transport' may take Grey Knights Rhinos instead of normal Rhinos.

rules.title: Iron Hands Transports
description: Iron Hands formations with 'plus transport' may take Siege Rhinos instead of normal Rhinos.

rules.title: Imperial Fists Transports
description: The Imperial Fists are a highly mobile army. Because of this, the points cost of a detachment usually includes enough Rhino and/or Siege Rhino transport vehicles to transport it and any upgrades that have been taken. Determine the number of Rhinos/Siege Rhinos needed after all upgrades have been purchased. The number of Rhinos/Siege Rhinos will always be the minimum needed to carry the formation, you can’t take extras along to cover any losses!

Note that many formations don’t receive Rhinos/Siege Rhinos, usually because they can’t fit into them. Detachments that come with Rhinos/Siege Rhinos will be noted as having plus transport in the units section of the army list opposite.
Also note that you don’t have to take Rhinos/Siege Rhinos if you don’t want to. If you’d rather field the formation on foot instead, so it can act as a garrison for example, then you may do so.

Before each game, after the opposing army is known but before objectives are placed, the Imperial Fists player may choose which formations with the plus transport aspect are deployed in Rhinos, Siege Rhinos, or on foot.

rules.title: White Scars Transports
description: The White Scars are an exceptionally mobile army. Because of this the points cost of a detachment usually includes enough transport vehicles to transport it and any upgrades that have been taken. The number of vehicles will always be the minimum needed to carry the formation, you can’t take extras along to cover any losses!

Note that many formations don’t receive transports, usually because they can’t fit into them. Detachments that come with vehicles will be noted as having 'plus transport'. White Scars detachments must take the transport vehicles for a detachment. You cannot leave them behind in order to use the unit as a garrison, to use teleport or in order to be deployed by a Thunderhawk.

In addition, you may choose to replace a detachment’s Rhinos with Drop Pods. If you do this then the detachment will enter play in a Drop Pod using the rules for Planetfall (see Planetfall). Note that if you choose to do this you will also require a Space Marine Strike Cruiser or Battle Barge to deploy the Drop Pods from.

Before each game, after the opposing army is known but before objectives are placed, the White Scars player may choose which formations with the plus transport aspect are deployed in Rhinos or Drop Pods. If the formation has any units unable to deploy in Drop Pods then that option cannot be selected.

rules.title: Navis Nobilite
description: Grey Knight spacecraft are among the fastest and best piloted ships in the Galaxy. If a Grey Knights Strike Cruiser has been bought, the Blood Ravens player counts as having a Strategy Rating of 6 for the purposes of choosing which turn the spacecraft will pass over the battlefield.

rules.title: Battle Veteran
description: Formations containing at least one model with the rule 'Battle Veteran' removes an additional blast marker whenever that formation rallies or regroups.

rules.title: Ad Hoc Detachments
description: By necessity, the Ordo Xenos has become experts of improvisation, rapidly mustering local allies and adapting to the Deathwatch's ever-changing roster of skills and individuals. For this reason, formations with Commander may also use the ability when their own or another friendly formation within 5cm of their formation is defending against an assault, declaring both formations to be intermingled (see 1.12.10). Once declared intermingled, the Commanders' formations follow all rules exactly as if the enemy had declared them intermingled. Note that if either player declares intermingling, the formations are intermingled.

rules.title: Xenos Horrificus
description: Together, the Deathwatch and the Ordo Xenos contain a galaxy's worth of experience of the Imperium's foes. For this reason, the Deathwatch player may re-roll one Strategy Roll per game.

rules.title: Wings of the Sky Angel
description: All Deathwatch Detachments must start the game in the reserves, transported in either a Dark Hunter Class Destroyer, a Corvus Blackstar Dropship, or a Deathwatch Thunderhawk Transporter.
In addition, all AA shots have an additional -1 to hit against Corvus Blackstar Dropships.

rules.title: Pack Hunters
description: Space Wolves units with the Commander ability extend the range at which they can call other formations to follow them when they make a combined assault from 5cm to 10cm (see 2.1.2).

rules.title: Independent
description: The Independent special rule allows a War Engine formation to operate as two independent War Engines for all purposes, including for determining the army BTS (each unit counts as its own formation worth half of the points value of the original formation, including upgrades). If one of the two War Engines are destroyed, the surviving one immediately recieves a Blast Marker.

rules.title: Teleport Homer
description: Units that Teleport within 15cm from a friendly, unbroken unit with Teleport Homer (except from teleporting formations) may re-roll 1:s when testing for Teleport Mishap.

In addition, formations that exclusively consists of models with Teleport may be set up in a spacecraft if such has been bought. From there, they can either teleport normally, or coordinate their teleport with the spacecraft's activation.

Teleports coordinated with a spacecraft activation happen after Orbital Barrage, Pin-Points and all events related to formations making Planetfall has been resolved. All such teleports counts as taking place simultaneously, not one after another. The entire formation must be placed within 15cm of a unit with the Teleport Homer special rule. If they are unable or unwilling to do so they must wait and teleport normally in later turns.

rules.title: Honour Guard
description: Units with the 'Honour Guard' special rule are considered Fearless while their formation contains a Supreme Commander character.

rules.title: Lucifer Pattern Engine
description: Units with the 'Lucifer Pattern Engine' special rule gain an additional 5cm Speed when their formation performs an Engage Action.
Blood Angels formations with 'plus transport' may use Blood Angels Rhinos instead of normal Rhinos.

rules.title: Guerilla Tactics
description: Whenever a formation with at least one unit that has the 'Guerilla Tactics' special rule wins an assault, units in the formation may consolidate up to their speed value rather than the normal 5cm.

rules.title: Expert Reconnaissance
description: Drop Pods that are placed within 30cm of a unit with the 'Expert Reconnaissance' special rule does not roll for scatter.

rules.title: Fleet of Foot
description: Dark Eldar and Harlequin formations may still lend support fire in assaults, help claim a crossfire bonus, and fire AA after taking a March action.

rules.title: Black Heart Coterie
description: The army must include a Black Heart Coterie. The enemy counts as having achieved the ‘Break Their Spirit’ (BTS) victory condition if they destroy this formation and/or the most expensive formation in the army.

rules.title: Wraithkind Coterie
description: The army must include a Wraithkind Coterie. The enemy counts as having achieved the ‘Break Their Spirit’ (BTS) victory condition if they destroy this formation and/or the most expensive formation in the army.

rules.title: Webway Portal
description: A army that includes any Webway Portals may place up to three formations in reserve, infantry units in these reserve formations may count as mounted in their transports. These formations may enter play by activating and moving onto the table through a friendly Webway Portal during the game, measuring their first move from any part of the position the portal occupies on the battlefield.

A Webway Portal may only be used once per turn, and if the formation fails to activate when attempting to enter via a Webway, it may only take a hold action offboard and regroup. Only INF, LV, or AVs with the Walker ability may use Webway Portals. H-AV units may not use portals unless noted otherwise.

If a Webway is in an enemy zone of control, any formation that enters through it must Engage that formation(s). In addition, if it is also directly under an enemy formation, any formation that enters must maximize base contact as much as possible.

rules.title: Large Webway Portal
description: Large Webway Portals follows all the rules for a normal Webway Portals, except AV units are not required to have Walker in order to enter the battlefield through it.

rules.title: Shadowfields
description: Each Shadowfield will automatically stop one point of damage and then go down. Do not make armour saves for damage stopped by Shadowfields, or allocate Blast Markers. Once all of a vehicle or war engine’s Shadowfields have been knocked down, it may be damaged normally and you may make saving throws against any hits that are scored. Hits from close combat ignore Shadowfields but units using their firefight values must first knock down any Shadowfields before they can cause any damage. While a vehicle or war engine has at least one operating Shadowfield it counts as being obscured (1.8.2), meaning that all shooting (including AA) without the Ignore Cover ability receive a -1 to hit modifier.

rules.title: Seers of Ulthwé
description: Craftworld Ulthwé armies counts as having Strategy Rating 5 for all purposes except for the Strategy Roll at the start of a turn. In addition, Ulthwé armies gets +1 to the Strategy Roll on the turn their Avatar arrives.

rules.title: Black Guardians
description: Black Guardian Warhosts ignore, and do not count for, the one per turn limit that normally applies to Webway Portals.

rules.title: Avatar (Biel-Tan)
description: The Avatar must begin the game in reserve. In the Strategy Phase of any turn, before the strategy roll place the Avatar within 15cm of a Farseer unit.
The Avatar counts as its own formation and may only enter play in this manner.
Remove the Avatar in the End Phase of that turn, before rallying formations. Once removed it may not return.

rules.title: Avatar (Lugganath)
description: The Avatar must begin the game in reserve. In the Strategy Phase of any turn, before the strategy roll place the Avatar within 15cm of a Farseer unit.
The Avatar counts as its own formation and may only enter play in this manner.
Remove the Avatar in the End Phase of that turn, before rallying formations. Once removed it may not return.

rules.title: Avatar (Saim-Hann)
description: The Avatar must begin the game in reserve. In the Strategy Phase of any turn, before the strategy roll place the Avatar within 15cm of a Mounted Farseer unit.
The Avatar counts as its own formation and may only enter play in this manner.
Remove the Avatar in the End Phase of that turn, before rallying formations. Once removed it may not return.

rules.title: Avatar (Iyanden)
description: The Avatar must begin the game in reserve. In the Strategy Phase of any turn, before the strategy roll place the Avatar within 15cm of a Spiritseer, Wraithseer or Farseer unit.
The Avatar counts as its own formation and may only enter play in this manner.
Remove the Avatar in the End Phase of that turn, before rallying formations. Once removed it may not return.

rules.title: Avatar (Ulthwé)
description: The Avatar must begin the game in reserve. In the Strategy Phase of any turn, before the strategy roll place the Avatar within 15cm of a Seer Council or Farseer unit.
The Avatar counts as its own formation and may only enter play in this manner.
Remove the Avatar in the End Phase of that turn, before rallying formations. Once removed it may not return.

rules.title: Avatar (Yme-Loc)
description: The Avatar must begin the game in reserve. In the Strategy Phase of any turn, before the strategy roll place the Avatar within 15cm of a Farseer unit.
The Avatar counts as its own formation and may only enter play in this manner.
Remove the Avatar in the End Phase of that turn, before rallying formations. Once removed it may not return.

rules.title: Avatar (Mymeara)
description: The Avatar must begin the game in reserve. In the Strategy Phase of any turn, before the strategy roll place the Avatar within 15cm of a Farseer unit.
The Avatar counts as its own formation and may only enter play in this manner.
Remove the Avatar in the End Phase of that turn, before rallying formations. Once removed it may not return.

rules.title: May not Garrison (Kabal of the Black Heart)
description: Only Mandrakes are allowed to garrison objectives in the Epic tournament game scenario.

rules.title: May not Garrison (Saim-Hann)
description: Only Saim-Hann Hornets are allowed to garrison objectives in the Epic tournament game scenario.

rules.title: May not Garrison (Iyanden)
description: Only Eldar Rangers and War Walkers are allowed to garrison objectives in the Epic tournament game scenario.

rules.title: May not Garrison (Biel-Tan)
description: Only Eldar Rangers and War Walkers are allowed to garrison objectives in the Epic tournament game scenario.

rules.title: May not Garrison (Ulthwé)
description: Only Eldar Rangers and War Walkers are allowed to garrison objectives in the Epic tournament game scenario.

rules.title: May not Garrison (Mymeara)
description: Only Ghost Walkers, Wasp Walkers and Hornets are allowed to garrison objectives in the Epic tournament game scenario.

rules.title: May not Garrison (Lugganath)
description: Only Ghost Walkers and Wasp Walkers are allowed to garrison objectives in the Epic tournament game scenario.

rules.title: May not Garrison (Yme-Loc)
description: Only Hornets are allowed to garrison objectives in the Epic tournament game scenario.

rules.title: May not Garrison (Fir Lirithion)
description: Only Bright Stallions are allowed to garrison objectives in the Epic tournament game scenario.

rules.title: May not Garrison (Black Heart)
description: Only Mandrakes are allowed to garrison objectives in the Epic tournament game scenario.

rules.title: May not Garrison (Wraithkind)
description: No formations are allowed to garrison objectives in the Epic tournament game scenario.

rules.title: Farsight
description: Eldar formations that include a unit with the Farsight ability may ignore the -1 penalty to Action test rolls when attempting to retain the Initiative.

In addition once per turn the Eldar player may attempt to retain the Initiative twice in a row (i.e. allowing the Eldar player to take 3 activations in a row). Any Eldar formation may be selected, including those without a unit with Farsight, but at least one unit with the Farsight ability must be in play on the battlefield.
The formation selected must still carry out an Action Test with a -1 modifier, unless the selected formation has a unit with the Farsight ability.

rules.title: Hit and Run
description: Eldar/Dark Eldar/Harlequin formations that perform an Advance or Double action may choose to shoot either before or after each move, but may still only shoot once. If the formation chooses to Double the -1 to hit penalty applies even if the shot is taken before moving. In addition, formations that win an assault may consolidate up to their speed value rather than the normal 5cms.

rules.title: Holofields (x)
description: Holofields provide a saving throw to the value of 'x'. This save may always be taken even against weapons with the Macro Weapon or Titan Killer abilities.

If a unit has Reinforced Armour it may use its re-roll unless hit by a Lance, Macro Weapon or Titan Killer attack but the re-roll uses the units armour value. Hits saved by the Holofield do not generate Blast Markers, even if they have the Disrupt ability.
Against Titan Killer attacks that cause extra damage make one Holofield save roll, if this is successful the unit takes no damage, if the roll fails it suffers all the damage.

Holofield saves can be reduced by modifiers such as the -1 to saves from a cross fire and weapons with the Sniper ability. If a unit with Holofield also has a save from being in Cover, it must choose which save to use.

rules.title: Lance
description: When units with Reinforced Armour are hit by a weapon with the Lance ability they do not get to re-roll failed armour saves.

rules.title: Independent Twins
description: Allows a formation of Revenant Titans to operate as two independent War Engines for all purposes, including for determining the army BTS. If one of the pair is destroyed, the surviving Revenant Twin receives a Blast Marker.
In addition, Independent Twins may use the Commander ability with its Twin. In this case, the Commander ability counts as having an unlimited range instead of the normal 5cm.

rules.title: Cegorach, the Laughing God
description: As long as there is at least one unit with a Harlequin Shadowseer character present on the battlefield, all enemy non-Harlequin formations counts as being within 30cm of an enemy unit (for the purposes of rally tests during the End Phase).

rules.title: Shadowsight
description: Harlequin formations that include a unit with the Shadowsight ability may ignore the -1 penalty to Action Test rolls when attempting to retain the Initiative.
In addition units that Teleport within 15cm from a friendly, unbroken unit with Shadowsight (including from teleporting formations) may re-roll 1:s when testing for Teleport Mishap.

rules.title: Masters of the Webway
description: Harlequins are the unparallelled masters of the Webway. This is represented by the following rules:
* Harlequin formations ignore, and do not count for, the one per turn or once per game limit that normally applies to Webway Portals.
* Must start the game in reserves, and may only enter the battlefield by using Teleport or a Webway portal. Do not count towards the maxiumum number of formations placed in reserve per Webway Portal.

* Harlequin formations may move back into the Webway using normal or consolidation movement. If they do so they counts as having re-entered the reserves. If broken, they must successfully rally before they can re-enter the table (either by Teleporting or through a Webway Portal).

rules.title: Dance of Shadows
description: Gives the enemy an additional -1 to hit modifier to all FF attacks against a formation with a Shadowseer.

rules.title: Summoning
description: Any formation that either has a unit with Daemonic Pact or a Daemonic Pact formation upgrade may summon Daemons. Each Daemonic Pact in the army automatically provides one point to the Lesser Daemon Pool at the start of the battle (the player may also purchase additional Lesser Daemon Pool points and/or Greater Daemon Pool points).

Daemon Pools are not faction specific. The size of the Daemon Pools must be visible to all players at all times and it is suggested that either tokens or dice are used to indicate the size of the pool. As daemons are summoned the pool must be changed to reflect its current size.

To summon daemons the formation declares its intention to summon before any action roll is made (but after the choice of action. If the formation that wishes to Summon is being transported inside another formation (e.g. a Chaos Thunderhawk) it cannot choose to Summon when the Chaos Thunderhawk prepares to activate). The player then rolls 2D3 to generate the number of Summoning Points available for this formation. The formation may then summon daemons up to the number of Summoning Points generated, with any points not used lost, up to the number of Lesser or Greater Daemon Pool points left.

Summoned units must be setup with their base completely within 5cm of any non-summoned unit in the summoning formation (i.e. You cannot place a chain of summoned units). If the summoning formation has the Transport ability, newly summoned units can be set up inside if there is space left. They cannot be placed in enemy zones of control or impassable terrain. Summoned units become part of the summoning formation for all rules purposes as long as they remain on the battlefield.

Summoned Lesser Daemons are Expendable, but they are otherwise counted as normal units, and are included when working out if a formation outnumbers an opponent in an assault or is broken by Blast Markers, etc. Note that Daemons that are killed in an assault do count towards the number of units killed by the enemy when working out modifiers for assault resolution.

Summoned units remain in play until the End Phase of the turn in which they were summoned. After all formations have attempted to rally any summoned units are removed from play and the total of their Daemon Pool cost is returned to the relevant Daemon Pool. This may cause the formation to break, if the number of Blast Markers now equals or exceeds the number of units in the formation.
When a formation becomes broken all its summoned units are destroyed.

When calculating victory points, the Lesser Daemon Pool scores half points if the pool has less than or equal to half (round up) its original number of daemons remaining. The Lesser Daemon Pool scores full points if the pool has less than or equal to a quarter (round up) its daemons remaining. Treat Greater Daemons as War Engines for the purpose of calculating victory points.

rules.title: Black Legion Summoning Rules
description: All formations in the Black Legion worship Chaos Undivided. Chaos Undivided formations with Daemonic Pact may summon any of the following Daemons (brackets indicating the Summoning Points cost):
Lesser Daemons: Daemonettes of Slaanesh (1), Plaguebearers of Nurgle (1), Bloodletters of Khorne (1), Horrors of Tzeentch (1), Daemonic Beasts of Chaos Undivided (1).
Greater Daemons: Slaanesh Keeper of Secrets (8), Nurgle Great Unclean One (8), Khorne Bloodthirster (8), Tzeentch Lord of Change (8)
No more than one of each type of Greater Daemon can be on the battlefield at the same time. No formation can contain more than one Greater Daemon at a time.
Note that while the Summoning Points cost of summoning each type of daemonic unit varies, the Daemon Pool cost is always one.

rules.title: Word Bearers Summoning Rules
description: All formations in Word Bearers worship Chaos Undivided. Chaos Undivided formations with Daemonic Pact may summon any of the following Daemons (brackets indicating the Summoning Points cost):
Lesser Daemons: Daemonettes of Slaanesh (1), Plaguebearers of Nurgle (1), Bloodletters of Khorne (1), Horrors of Tzeentch (1), Daemonic Beasts of Chaos Undivided (1).
Greater Daemons: Slaanesh Keeper of Secrets (8), Nurgle Great Unclean One (8), Khorne Bloodthirster (8), Tzeentch Lord of Change (8)
No more than one of each type of Greater Daemon can be on the battlefield at the same time. No formation can contain more than one Greater Daemon at a time.
Note that while the Summoning Points cost of summoning each type of daemonic unit varies, the Daemon Pool cost is always one.

rules.title: Emperor's Children Summoning Rules
description: All formations in Emperor's Children worship the Prince of Pleasure, Slaanesh. Formations with Daemonic Pact may summon the following Daemons (brackets indicating the Summoning Points cost):
Lesser Daemons: Daemonettes of Slaanesh (1), Fiends of Slaanesh (1), Seekers of Slaanesh (2)
Greater Daemons: Keeper of Secrets (8)
No more than one of each type of Greater Daemon can be on the battlefield at the same time. No formation can contain more than one Greater Daemon at a time.
Note that while the Summoning Points cost of summoning each type of daemonic unit varies, the Daemon Pool cost is always one.

rules.title: Death Guard Summoning Rules
description: All formations in Death Guard worship the Plague Lord, Nurgle. Formations with Daemonic Pact may summon the following Daemons (brackets indicating the Summoning Points cost):
Lesser Daemons: Plaguebearers of Nurgle (1), Beasts of Nurgle (1), Plague Drones of Nurgle (2)
Greater Daemons: Great Unclean One (8)
No more than one of each type of Greater Daemon can be on the battlefield at the same time. No formation can contain more than one Greater Daemon at a time.
Note that while the Summoning Points cost of summoning each type of daemonic unit varies, the Daemon Pool cost is always one.

rules.title: World Eaters Summoning Rules
description: All formations in World Eaters worship the Blood God, Khorne. Formations with Daemonic Pact may summon the following Daemons (brackets indicating the Summoning Points cost):
Lesser Daemons: Bloodletters of Khorne (1), Fleshhounds of Khorne (1), Bloodcrushers of Khorne (2)
Greater Daemons: Bloodthirster (8)
No more than one of each type of Greater Daemon can be on the battlefield at the same time. No formation can contain more than one Greater Daemon at a time.
Note that while the Summoning Points cost of summoning each type of daemonic unit varies, the Daemon Pool cost is always one.

rules.title: Thousand Sons Summoning Rules
description: All formations in Thousand Sons worship the Changer of Ways, Tzeentch. Formations with Daemonic Pact may summon the following Daemons (brackets indicating the Summoning Points cost):
Lesser Daemons: Horrors of Tzeentch (1), Flamers of Tzeentch (1), Screamers of Tzeentch (2)
Greater Daemons: Lord of Change (8)
No more than one of each type of Greater Daemon can be on the battlefield at the same time. No formation can contain more than one Greater Daemon at a time.
Note that while the Summoning Points cost of summoning each type of daemonic unit varies, the Daemon Pool cost is always one.
Add one Lesser Daemon Pool point to the Lesser Daemon Pool for each unit (Aspiring Sorcerer, Exalted Sorcerer, Daemon Prince of Tzeentch) or formation with Daemonic Pact.

rules.title: Lost and the Damned Summoning Rules
description: All Chaos Cultists formations in the Lost and the Damned worship Chaos Undivided. Formations with Daemonic Pact may summon the following Daemons (brackets indicating the Summoning Points cost):
Lesser Daemons: Daemonettes of Slaanesh (2), Plaguebearers of Nurgle (2), Bloodletters of Khorne (2), Horrors of Tzeentch (2), Daemonic Beasts of Chaos Undivided (1)
Greater Daemons: Keeper of Secrets (8), Great Unclean One (8), Bloodthirster (8), Lord of Change (8)
No more than one of each type of Greater Daemon can be on the battlefield at the same time. No formation can contain more than one Greater Daemon at a time.
Note that while the Summoning Points cost of summoning each type of daemonic unit varies, the Daemon Pool cost is always one.

rules.title: Alpha Legion Summoning Rules
description: All Alpha Legion Cultist formations worship Chaos Undivided. Formations with Daemonic Icon may summon the following Daemons (brackets indicating the Summoning Points cost):
Lesser Daemons: Daemonettes of Slaanesh (2), Plaguebearers of Nurgle (2), Bloodletters of Khorne (2), Horrors of Tzeentch (2), Daemonic Beasts of Chaos Undivided (1)
Note that while the Summoning Points cost of summoning each type of daemonic unit varies, the Daemon Pool cost is always one.

rules.title: Night Lords Summoning Rules
description: All Night Lords formations are aligned with Chaos Undivided. Formations with a unit with Daemonic Pact may summon the following Daemons (brackets indicating the Summoning Points cost):
Lesser Daemons: Furies of Chaos Undivided (2)
Note that while the Summoning Points cost of summoning each type of daemonic unit varies, the Daemon Pool cost is always one.

rules.title: Slaves to Darkness Summoning Rules
description: All formations in the Slaves to Darkness worship Chaos Undivided. Formations with either a Daemonic Icon unit or a Daemonic Pact formation upgrade may summon the following Daemons (brackets indicating the Summoning Points cost):
Lesser Daemons: Daemonettes of Slaanesh (2), Plaguebearers of Nurgle (2), Bloodletters of Khorne (2), Horrors of Tzeentch (2), Daemonic Beasts of Chaos Undivided (1)
Note that while the Summoning Points cost of summoning each type of daemonic unit varies, the Daemon Pool cost is always one.
Add one Lesser Daemon Pool point to the Lesser Daemon Pool for each unit with Daemonic Icon, or formation with Daemonic Pact.

rules.title: Daemonic Incursion Summoning Rules
description: Formations in a Daemonic Incursion army may summon Lesser Daemons from the power they are aligned with (Portals & Mortals formations are aligned with Chaos Undivided). They do not need an upgrade to do so  (brackets indicating the Summoning Points cost):
Slaanesh: Daemonettes of Slaanesh (1), Fiends of Slaanesh (1), Seekers of Slaanesh (2)
Nurgle: Plaguebearers of Nurgle (1), Beasts of Nurgle (1), Plague Drones of Nurgle (2)
Khorne: Bloodletters of Khorne (1), Fleshhounds of Khorne (1), Bloodcrushers of Khorne (2)
Tzeentch: Horrors of Tzeentch (1), Flamers of Tzeentch (1), Screamers  of Tzeentch (2)
Chaos Undivided: Daemonettes of Slaanesh (2), Plaguebearers of Nurgle (2), Bloodletters of Khorne (2), Horrors of Tzeentch (2), Daemonic Beasts of Chaos Undivided (1).
Note that while the Summoning Points cost of summoning each type of daemonic unit varies, the Daemon Pool cost is always one.

When calculating Victory Points of the purposes of Tie Break, only the part of the Lesser Daemon Pool that was bought by itself is considered when checking if there is less than half remaining. Lesser Daemon Pool points that was bought as part of a formation are counted towards that formation's starting units.

rules.title: TTL Summoning Rules
description: TTL formations with Daemonic Pact may summon Lesser Daemons from the power they are aligned with (brackets indicating the Summoning Points cost):
Slaanesh: Daemonettes of Slaanesh (1), Fiends of Slaanesh (1)
Nurgle: Plaguebearers of Nurgle (1), Beasts of Nurgle (1)
Khorne: Bloodletters of Khorne (1), Fleshhounds of Khorne (1)
Tzeentch: Horrors of Tzeentch (1), Flamers of Tzeentch (1)
Chaos Undivided: Daemonettes of Slaanesh (2), Plaguebearers of Nurgle (2), Bloodletters of Khorne (2), Horrors of Tzeentch (2), Daemonic Beasts of Chaos Undivided (1)
Note that while the Summoning Points cost of summoning each type of daemonic unit varies, the Daemon Pool cost is always one.

rules.title: QT Summoning Rules
description: Formations with Daemonic Pact in a Questor Traitoris army may summon Lesser Daemons from the power they are aligned with (brackets indicating the Summoning Points cost):
Slaanesh: Daemonettes of Slaanesh (1), Fiends of Slaanesh (1)
Nurgle: Plaguebearers of Nurgle (1), Beasts of Nurgle (1)
Khorne: Bloodletters of Khorne (1), Fleshhounds of Khorne (1)
Tzeentch: Horrors of Tzeentch (1), Flamers of Tzeentch (1)
Chaos Undivided: Daemonettes of Slaanesh (2), Plaguebearers of Nurgle (2), Bloodletters of Khorne (2), Horrors of Tzeentch (2), Daemonic Beasts of Chaos Undivided (1)
Note that while the Summoning Points cost of summoning each type of daemonic unit varies, the Daemon Pool cost is always one.

rules.title: Augment Summoning (+x)
description: Units with Augment Summoning (+x) add a number of summoning points equal to 'x' when the formation they are in summons daemons (see Summoning). For example, a unit noted as having Augment Summoning (+2) would allow a formation with a Daemonic Pact to roll 2D3+2 for summoning points as opposed to the usual 2D3.

rules.title: CSM Characters
description: Chaos Space Marine Characters may only be added to INF units that are not formation upgrades.

rules.title: Daemonic Focus
description: Units with Daemonic focus may keep any or all summoned units that belong to the formation in play. Summoned units do not vanish back into the warp after the formation has attempted to rally. Daemonic Focus may not be used to keep summoned units in play if the formation is broken. Multiples of Daemonic Focus have no additional effect.

rules.title: Fickle Masters
description: In the Strategy Phase of each turn if the Chaos player rolls a 6, they are rewarded with 1D3 summoning points to add to the Lesser Daemon Pool. However, if a 1 is rolled 1D3 summoning points is lost from the Lesser Daemon Pool. In the latter case, if no Lesser Daemon Pool has been purchased, or if it is empty, then there is no effect.

rules.title: The Architect of Fate
description: In the Strategy Phase of each turn if the Thousand Sons player rolls a 6, they count as having 5 in Strategy Rating that turn. However, if a 1 is rolled, they count as having 3 in Strategy Rating that turn.

rules.title: Daemon Engine (x)
description: Formations where at least one unit has the Daemon Engine (x) special rule gain the bonus associated with that faction:
Slaanesh: Formation gains +1 to activate when attempting to Double.
Nurgle: Formation gains +1 to activate when attempting to Marshal.
Khorne: Formation gains +1 to activate when attempting to Engage.
Tzeentch: Formation gains +1 to activate when attempting to Advance.
Chaos Undivided: Formation ignores the -1 modifier for enemy formations within 30cm when rallying.

rules.title: Black Legion Dreadclaws
description: Dreadclaws allow a Chaos formation to enter play using the planetfall rules if a spaceship has been purchased to carry them. Units in a formation with Dreadclaws deploy using the planetfall rules but do not roll for scatter. Place the first unit within 15cm of the pre-plotted drop zone co-ordinates and place all other units in the formation within 15cm of this unit and in coherency. Units may not be placed in impassable terrain or enemy zones of control.

The following units may be deployed using Dreadclaws: Noise Marines, Rubric Marines, Khorne Berzerkers, Plague Marines, Chaos Space Marines, Havocs, Chaos Terminators, Obliterators, Chaos Dreadnoughts.

rules.title: Night Lords Dreadclaws
description: Dreadclaws allow a Chaos formation to enter play using the planetfall rules if a spaceship has been purchased to carry them. Units in a formation with Dreadclaws deploy using the planetfall rules but do not roll for scatter. Place the first unit within 15cm of the pre-plotted drop zone co-ordinates and place all other units in the formation within 15cm of this unit and in coherency. Units may not be placed in impassable terrain or enemy zones of control.
The following units may be deployed using Dreadclaws: Night Lords Assault Marines, Atramentar Terminators, Night Lords Dreadnoughts.

rules.title: Word Bearers Dreadclaws
description: Dreadclaws allow a Chaos formation to enter play using the planetfall rules if a spaceship has been purchased to carry them. Units in a formation with Dreadclaws deploy using the planetfall rules but do not roll for scatter. Place the first unit within 15cm of the pre-plotted drop zone co-ordinates and place all other units in the formation within 15cm of this unit and in coherency. Units may not be placed in impassable terrain or enemy zones of control.
The following units may be deployed using Dreadclaws: Chaos Space Marines, Havocs, Chaos Terminators, Word Bearers Possessed, Chaos Dreadnoughts.

rules.title: Alpha Legion Dreadclaws
description: Dreadclaws allow Alpha Legion formations to enter play using the planetfall rules if a spaceship has been purchased to carry them. Units in a formation with Dreadclaws deploy using the planetfall rules but do not roll for scatter. Place the first unit within 15cm of the pre-plotted drop zone co-ordinates and place all other units in the formation within 15cm of this unit and in coherency. Units may not be placed in impassable terrain or enemy zones of control.
The following units may be deployed using Dreadclaws: Alpha Legion Marines, Alpha Legion Havocs, Headhunters, Lernaean Terminators, Alpha Legion Dreadnoughts.

rules.title: Emperor's Children Dreadclaws
description: Dreadclaws  allow  a  chaos  formation  to  enter  play  using  the  planetfall  rules  if  a  spaceship  has  been purchased to carry them. Units in a formation with Dreadclaws deploy using the planetfall rules but do not roll for scatter. Place the first unit within 15cm of the pre-plotted drop zone co-ordinates and place all other units in the formation within 15cm of this unit and in coherency. Units may not be placed in impassable terrain or enemy zones of control.
The following units may be deployed using Dreadclaws: Noise Marines, Chaos Space Marines, Havocs, Sirenshriek Terminators, Chaos Dreadnoughts.

rules.title: Iron Warriors Dreadclaws
description: Dreadclaws allow a Chaos formation to enter play using the planetfall rules if a spaceship has been purchased to carry them. Units in a formation with Dreadclaws deploy using the planetfall rules but do not roll for scatter. Place the first unit within 15cm of the pre-plotted drop zone co-ordinates and place all other units in the formation within 15cm of this unit and in coherency. Units may not be placed in impassable terrain or enemy zones of control.
The following units may be deployed using Dreadclaws: Chaos Space Marines, Iron Warriors Assault Marines, Havocs, Obliterators, Tyrant Terminators, Chaos Dreadnoughts, Chaos Siege Dreadnoughts.

rules.title: World Eaters Dreadclaws
description: Dreadclaws  allow  a  chaos  formation  to  enter  play  using  the  planetfall  rules  if  a  spaceship  has  been purchased to carry them. Units in a formation with Dreadclaws deploy using the planetfall rules but do not roll for scatter. Place the first unit within 15cm of the pre-plotted drop zone co-ordinates and place all other units in the formation within 15cm of this unit and in coherency. Units may not be placed in impassable terrain or enemy zones of control.
The following units may be deployed using Dreadclaws: Khorne Berzerkers, World Eaters Marines, Skullseeker Terminators, Dreadnoughts, Mutilators.

rules.title: Infestation
description: Formations completely made up of units with the infestation special rule must be held in reserve and deployed using the teleport rules.
Formations containing any units with the infestation ability may only contest scenario objectives.

rules.title: LatD Eternal Animosity
description: Each Support Coven in a Lost and the Damned army owes allegiance to either one of the Ruinous Powers or to Chaos Undivided. With the exception of Chaos Undivided, the different factions harbour eternal animosity against each other. This state of affairs is represented by the following rules:
A Lost and the Damned army with formations belonging to the faction of Khorne may not include formations from the faction of Slaanesh (and vice-versa).
A Lost and the Damned army with formations belonging to the faction of Nurgle may not include formations from the faction of Tzeentch (and vice-versa).

rules.title: StD Eternal Animosity
description: Each Dark Mechanicus allied formation in a Slaves to Darkness army owes allegiance to either one of the Ruinous Powers or to Chaos Undivided. With the exception of Chaos Undivided, the different factions harbour eternal animosity against each other. This state of affairs is represented by the following rules:
A Slaves to Darkness army with formations belonging to the faction of Khorne may not include formations from the faction of Slaanesh (and vice-versa).
A Slaves to Darkness army with formations belonging to the faction of Nurgle may not include formations from the faction of Tzeentch (and vice-versa).

rules.title: DI Eternal Animosity
description: Each Daemon Formation in a Daemonic Incursion army owes allegiance to either one of the Ruinous Powers. With the exception of Chaos Undivided, the different factions harbour eternal animosity against each other. This state of affairs is represented by the following rules:
A Daemonic Incursion army with formations belonging to the faction of Khorne may not include formations from the faction of Slaanesh (and vice-versa).
A Daemonic Incursion army with formations belonging to the faction of Nurgle may not include formations from the faction of Tzeentch (and vice-versa).

rules.title: TTL Eternal Animosity
description: Each formation in a Traitor Titan Legion army owes allegiance to either one of the Ruinous Powers or Chaos Undivided. With the exception of Chaos Undivided, the different factions harbour eternal animosity against each other. This state of affairs is represented by the following rules:
A Traitor Titan Legion army with formations belonging to the faction of Khorne may not include formations from the faction of Slaanesh (and vice-versa).
A Traitor Titan Legion army with formations belonging to the faction of Nurgle may not include formations from the faction of Tzeentch (and vice-versa).

rules.title: QT Eternal Animosity
description: Each formation in a Questor Traitoris army owes allegiance to either one of the Ruinous Powers or Chaos Undivided. With the exception of Chaos Undivided, the different factions harbour eternal animosity against each other. This state of affairs is represented by the following rules:
A Questor Traitoris army with formations belonging to the faction of Khorne may not include formations from the faction of Slaanesh (and vice-versa).
A Questor Traitoris army with formations belonging to the faction of Nurgle may not include formations from the faction of Tzeentch (and vice-versa).

rules.title: Reign of Chaos
description: During the Strategy Phase the Daemon Incursion player rolls 2d6 and picks the highest. In addition add the dice together and consult the following table:
(2-3) *Chaotic Ebb* All Daemon Legion units (friend and foe) loses their Invulnerable Save for the rest of the turn.
(4-5) *The Winds Recede* All players that can summon Daemons lose 1D3 Lesser Daemons Pool points. Daemon Incursion players lose an additional D3. If the pool is empty nothing happens.
(6-8) *Eye of the Storm* Nothing happens.
(9-10) *The Winds Wax* All players that can summon Daemons gains 1D3 Lesser Daemons Pool points. Daemon Incursion players gains an additional D3.
(11-12) *Chaotic Surge* All Daemon Legion units (friend and foe) improves their Invulnerable Save to 5+ for the rest of the turn.

rules.title: The Great Ritual
description: All Exalted Greater Daemons and all Daemon Legion formations must be held in the reserves at the start of the game. Exalted Greater Daemons must enter play through a Warp Rift. Daemon Legion formations may only enter the battlefield through a Chaos Gate.

rules.title: Terror From Beyond
description: All Exalted Greater Daemon formations must be destroyed in order for the opponent to claim the Daemonic Incursion BTS objective. All Exalted Greater Daemon formations in the reserves are destroyed if they are still there during the End Phase of turn 3.

In addition, as long as the Daemon Incursion army still contains any Exalted Greater Daemons it may re-roll a single failed Initiative test of any type once per turn (unless all surviving Exalted Greater Daemons are located in the reserves).

rules.title: Daemonic Instability
description: When any Exalted Greater Daemon formation or Daemon Legions formation becomes broken for any reason, it is immediately destroyed.

rules.title: Warp Rift
description: Warp Rifts are plotted exactly as Self Planetfall. Both the turn in which the formation arrives and the landing coordinates must be recorded. The turn each formation arrives does not have to be announced.
On the designated turn the Warp Rift formation is activated in the normal activation sequence, as with Self Planetfall.
First the action for the formation must be decided. After this roll to summon daemons, and then roll to activate. If the unit fails to activate its arrival is delayed to the next following turn.

If the activation is successful, place a Warp Rift token at the plotted coordinates. This may be moved 15cm in any direction, and then scatters 3D6cm. If the Warp Rift token lands on terrain that is impassable or dangerous for it, or on top of any sort of unit (friend or foe), or in an enemy zone of control, then it is moved by the opposing player to the nearest area of clear ground. If this happens, also place a Blast Marker on the activating formation.

With the final location of the the Warp Rift determined, it attacks any enemy formations within range of the Warp Rift (15cm, AP6+/AT6+, Disrupt). Finally, the activated formation carries out the order determined at the start of its action, and must move the formation out of the Warp Rift, measuring all moves from the centre point of the token.
All units from the activating formation must move out of the Warp Rift. Any units that are unable to exit the Warp Rift are destroyed. The Warp Rift token is then removed from the battlefield.

rules.title: Chaos Gates
description: Chaos Gates functions as permanent Warp Rift tokens. Any number of formations can use a Chaos Gate per turn.
Chaos Gates that are also objectives cannot be destroyed, while Chaos Gates mounted on War Engines are destroyed if that War Engine is destroyed.

Any formation that enters the battlefield through a Chaos Gate mounted on a War Engine that is broken recieves a Blast Marker. Measure all movement from the Chaos Gate from the centre the token, or the edge of the War Engine.

If a Chaos Gate is in an enemy zone of control, any formation that enters through it must Engage that formation(s). In addition, if it is also directly under an enemy formation, any formation that enters must maximize base contact as much as possible.

rules.title: The Harrowing
description: Alpha Legion armies counts as having Strategy Rating 5 for all purposes except for the Strategy Roll at the start of a turn.

rules.title: Sabotage
description: Before rolling for the first turn and before teleports the player may select one enemy formation per formation of containing at least one unit with the 'Sabotage' special rule (both formations must have been deployed on the battlefield) and roll a D6.

On 2-5, the enemy formation begins the game with a Blast Marker. On a roll of 6, it begins with d3 Blast Markers. On a roll of 1, the formation with 'Sabotage' recieves a Blast Marker. No formation may be subject to Sabotage more than once, even if the first roll is a 1.

rules.title: Alpha Legion Transports
description: The Alpha Legion are a highly mobile army. Because of this, the points cost of a detachment usually includes enough Rhino transport vehicles to transport it and any upgrades that have been taken. Determine the number of Rhinos needed after all upgrades have been purchased. The number of Rhinos will always be the minimum needed to carry the formation, you can’t take extras along to cover any losses!

Note that many formations don’t receive Rhinos, usually because they can’t fit into them. Detachments that come with Rhinos will be noted as having plus transport in the units section of the army list opposite.

Also note that you don’t have to take Rhinos if you don’t want to. If you’d rather field the formation on foot instead, so it can act as a garrison for example, or be transported in a Storm Eagle, then you may do so.

In addition, you may choose to replace a detachment’s Rhinos with Dreadclaws. If you do this then the detachment will enter play in a Dreadclaw using the rules for Planetfall (see Planetfall). Note that if you choose to do this you will also require a Chaos Strike Cruiser deploy the Dreadclaws from.

Before each game, after the opposing army is known but before objectives are placed, the Alpha Legion player may choose which formations with the plus transport aspect are deployed in Rhinos, Dreadclaws or on foot. If the formation has any units unable to deploy in Dreadclaws then that option cannot be selected.

rules.title: In Midnight Clad
description: Furies of Chaos Undivided that are killed in an assault do not count for Combat Resolution as long as the controlling Night Lords player initiated the assault.

rules.title: Claws Forever Red
description: In addition to being counted for suppression, Night Lords units may also use Small Arms to shoot. While incapable of doing direct damage, this will still inflict a Blast Marker on enemy formations that come under fire.

rules.title: Ambush
description: Formations where all units have the Ambush special rule may use any objective except the enemy Blitz when setting up garrisons. Units using enemy objectives may be set up on the enemy table half, but may not be deployed within 30cm of the enemy deployment board edge, or within 10cm of any Bunkers or Trenches on the enemy table half.

rules.title: Nexus Brood
description: The army must include a Nexus Brood formation. The enemy will only count as having achieved their Break Their Spirit (BTS) victory condition if this formation is destroyed, even if it is not the single most expensive formation in the army.
All units in the Nexus Brood formation are considered Fearless as long as it contains a Genestealer Patriarch unit.
If the Genestealer Patriarch unit is killed, all Cult Formations (see 'Brood Brothers' special rule) suffers one Blast Marker.

rules.title: Necron Reserves
description: Any Necron formation that can enter the battlefield by Teleport or via a Necron Portal can be held back in reserve. Any Necron formation located in the reserves during the End Phase of the third turn and onwards is considered destroyed for the purpose of tiebreak and the Break Their Spirit tournament scenario objective.

rules.title: Necron Garrisons
description: Only Necron Phalanx and Tomb Guardian formations may garrison in Epic Tournament scenarios. Necron Phalanx may only garrison from a Tomb Complex objective.

rules.title: The Unbidden
description: Necron armies must contain at least one 'The Unbidden' formation of Flayed Ones. Flayed Ones may only contest objectives, must start the game in the reserves, and may not use Necron Portals.

rules.title: Regeneration
description: Regeneration functions exactly like an Invulnerable Save except that it is a 5+ save rather than 6+.
Against Titan Killer attacks, WE and H-AV must make one Invulnerable Save against each point of damage.

rules.title: Necron Portals
description: Necron Portals can only be used by INF and by any unit that has 'Walker'. Each portal can be used only once per turn for either entering or exiting the battlefield, but not both.

A formation that is in the reserves may enter play via a unit with 'Portal' as part of any activation that allows movement. Measure their movement using the centre of the objective token or edge of the unit. Additionally, formations may leave the board and re-enter the reserves by moving into a Portal. Once in the reserves they can re-enter play immediately via another Portal (provided they have any moves left) or stay in the reserves. Formations with teleport that have re-entered the reserves may teleport at the start of the next turn as normal.
Any units that are out of coherency at the end of any move is destroyed.
Each time a formation uses a broken Portal it receives one Blast Marker.

If a Portal is in an enemy zone of control, any formation that enters through it must Engage that formation(s). In addition, if it is also directly under an enemy formation, any formation that enters must maximize base contact as much as possible.

rules.title: Implacable Advance
description: Necron formations receive a +1 bonus when attempting to perform a Marshal action. Necron formations may not take March actions.

rules.title: Ponderous
description: Units with the Ponderous special rule may only make a single withdrawal move instead of two when becoming broken or failing to rally.

rules.title: Phase Out
description: At the beginning of each turn's End Phase, before rallying, remove all broken Necron formations (except formations where at least one unit has 'Enduring') from the board into the reserves. Formations that fail to rally in the End Phase must remain in the reserves until the next turn's End Phase.

rules.title: Enduring
description: Necron formations containing units with 'Enduring' don’t phase out in the End Phase. If the formation has lost all units with 'Enduring' it phases out as normal.

rules.title: Big Mek
description: Every Gargant Big Mob army must include a Supreme Command character called a Big Mek, which is free. If the army includes any Mega Gargant, then the Big Mek must be placed in it. If there are no Mega Gargants in the army then the Big Mek will join a Great Gargant.

rules.title: Snakebite Clan Warlords
description: Every Snakebite Clan army must include a Supreme Command character called a Warlord. The Warlord character is free, you don’t have to pay any points for it. The Warlord is attached to the largest formation in the army, each DC counts towards working out formation sizes.

rules.title: Push 'Em Harder Ladz
description: Whenever a Supa-Stompa or any type of Gargant passes an Action Test that allows movement, the player may opt to change the unit's speed rating to 20cm for the entire duration of the chosen Action, however if this ability is used the model will receive a Critical Hit for with each move that is carried out.

rules.title: Mob Rule
description: Orks believe that as long as there’s a bunch of them still fighting together (slightly more than they can count up to is ideal!) then there’s always a chance that they’ll prevail, no matter the odds. To represent this, Ork formations with more than five units (i.e., too many to count on the fingers of one hand), not including Gretchin or Big Gunz units, receive a +1 modifier to any rally rolls they make, and formations with more than 10 such units receive a +2 modifier. For the purposes of this rule War Engines count each point of starting damage capacity as a unit.

rules.title: Power of the Waaagh!
description: Orks are not noted for their organisational abilities, and thus usually have a pretty low Initiative. However, if there is one thing that will galvanise an Ork warband, it’s the thought of a good punch-up! Because of this, Ork formations that are attempting to take engage or double actions receive a +2 modifier to their Action Test roll. Ork Flyboyz similarly relish the chance to shoot things up, and receive a +2 modifier to their Action Test roll when attempting to carry out Interception or Ground Attack actions (see Aircraft).

rules.title: Clan Goffs Warlord
description: Every Warhorde army must include a Supreme Commander character called a Warlord. The Warlord character is free, you don’t have to pay any points for it. If the army includes any Gargants, then the Warlord must be placed in one of them. If there are no Gargants in the army then the Warlord will join a Supa-Stompa or Nobz unit.

rules.title: Speed Freeks Warlord
description: Every Speed Freeks army must include a Supreme Commander character called a Warlord. The Warlord character is free, you don’t have to pay any points for it. The Warlord must be placed in a Nob Warbikes or a Nobz unit.

rules.title: Coordinated Fire
description: A formation that contains at least one unit with Coordinated Fire can order up to two other un-broken formations within 15cm that have not taken an action this turn to follow their own formation when they take an Advance, Double or Sustained Fire action.

Make a single Initiative roll for all foarmations, counting a single -1 modifier if any have Blast Markers. If the test is failed then the original formation (containing the unit calling for Coordinated Fire) receives a Blast Marker and must take a hold action. The other formations are unaffected (and may take an action later in the turn). If the test is passed then all formations concerned are allowed to take either an Advance, Double or Sustained Fire action.

There is no obligation for all formations to take the same action, and these actions may be resolved in any order, but they must all fire at the same target formation. If the formation being activated is unable or unwilling to fire at the selected formation, it cannot fire at all that turn. The formations don’t have to stay within a given distance of each other and will complete their actions one after the other. Each formations action is declared and resolved (including testing to see if the target formation breaks) before moving on to the next Tau formation.

rules.title: Deflector Shield
description: Tau Deflector Shields work like an Invulnerable Save in all respects, except it is 5+ instead of 6+. Against Titan Killer attacks, WE and H-AV must make one Invulnerable Save against each point of damage.

rules.title: Guided Missiles
description: Guided Missiles may be fired without Line of Sight, but may only be fired at a targets that are Marked with Markerlights.

Guided Missiles follow all the normal suppression rules. If a unit with a Guided Missile weapon is within range and Line of Sight to a unit in the target formation then it is counted for suppression purposes, even if the target formation is not Marked.
Guided Missiles counts as having Line of Sight to all units in a Marked formation for the purpose of suppression, Crossfire and when shooting as part of an Overwatch action.

rules.title: Markerlights
description: All enemy formations with at least one unit within 30cm range and Line of Sight of at least one Tau unit with the Markerlights special rule is considered to be Marked. When shooting at a Marked formation, all ranged firepower attacks gain an additional +1 modifier to their To-Hit roll. This bonus for shooting at a Marked enemy may not be used when making Anti-Aircraft attacks, or with BP type attacks. A Tau formation that is broken or has Marched this turn may not mark enemy formations.

rules.title: Tau Jet Packs
description: Tau Jet Packs follow all the rules for Jump Packs. In addition, formations that exclusively consists of units with Tau Jet Packs are allowed to make an extra move of up to 10cm at the end of an Advance, Double or March action. The extra move is allowed whether or not the unit fires and takes place after any firing. This extra move may be in any direction and follows all the normal movement rules, so unit coherency and zones of control must be adhered to as usual.

rules.title: Tiger Shark Gun Drones
description: Transported Gun Drone formations may be split across multiple Tiger Sharks as an exception to the normal aircraft transport rules. The Tiger Sharks cannot land, Engage, or embark units, but can disembark transported Gun Drones after an approach move. The Gun Drone formation may shoot when it disembarks as normal (see Transporting Ground Units), and counts as having activated for that turn. After this initial deployment the Gun Drones are a completely independent formation.

rules.title: Synapse
description: The following rules applies to Primary and Secondary Synapse Swarm formations only. Synapse creatures are any unit with the 'Synapse' special rule. A Synapse Swarm with no remaining Synapse creatures has an Initiative Rating of 3+ and may neither capture nor contest objectives, including They Shall Not Pass.

A Synapse Swarm with remaining Synapse creatures can absorb other Synapse Swarm formations with no remaining Synapse creatures at the end of its action. The formation must have one unit within 5cm of a unit from the formation(s) being absorbed. The units and Blast Markers of an absorbed formation become part of the formation (broken formations are considered to have an equal number of Blast Markers as the number of remaining units/starting DC). An absorbed formation is considered completely destroyed for the purposes of tie-break and the Break Their Spirit objective.

rules.title: Hive Mind Locus
description: As long as the Tyranid army contains a unit with Hive Mind Locus it may re-roll a single failed Initiative test (of any type) once per turn (unless all units with Hive Mind Locus are located offboard).
Hive Mind Locus also allows the formation to remove an additional Blast Marker when rallying.

rules.title: Shoot the Big Ones!
description: The enemies of the Tyranids have learned that destroying the Hive Mind's Synapse Creatures will cause Tyranid swarms to become disorganized. For this reason certain units which normally would be Infantry are instead Light Vehicles.

rules.title: Extreme Mobility
description: Tyranid AV and WE units do not take dangerous terrain tests. Tyranid LV units move through terrain and receive cover as if they were INF. Fortified positions such as Minefields, Razor Wire, and special terrain features such as Lava Flows affect Tyranids normally.

rules.title: Extreme Mobility (Cult of the Star-Spawn)
description: Lictors move through terrain and receive cover as if they were INF.

rules.title: Gaunts
description: Termagants, Hormagaunts, Gargoyles, and Raveners that are killed in an assault do not count for combat resolution as long as the controlling Tyranid player initiated the assault and there is at least one model with Synapse still present in the formation.

rules.title: Dagon Vanguard Organisms
description: Only Genestealers, Lictors, and Nest Swarms may deploy as garrisons.

rules.title: Hydra Vanguard Organisms
description: Only Genestealers, Lictors, and Dimachaeron may deploy as garrisons.

rules.title: Swarm (x)
description: In the End Phase, before formations have rallied, all unbroken Tyranid formations with both Swarm (x) and Synapse creatures may 'Swarm'.

For each Swarm point, one unit with the 'Gaunts' rule that has been lost during the battle may be added to the formation, but each unit with 'Swarm (x)' may only bring back the types of units that are within brackets next to its 'Gaunt Pouch'.

All units returned to play in this manner must be placed within 5cm of a unit from the formation that was there prior to Swarming, and may not be placed in enemy zones of control or impassable terrain. Not all generated Swarm points need to be used, but may not be saved for future turns.

rules.title: General Tournament Tiebreaker Rules
description: If a player gives up the game, or does not show up within 30 minutes it is scored as a Total Victory for the opponent. If a game must be abandoned before turn 4 because of lack of time, the current objective total determines the score, with a -4 penalty for both sides if the game ended prematurely in turn 2, and a -2 penalty for both sides if the game ended prematurely in turn 3. If one player was late to the game start by more than 5 minutes, that player takes both player’s penalties.

rules.title: Broodmind
description: As long as at least one Genestealer Patriarch, Genestealer Primus, or Genestealer Magus in the army is alive, all Genestealer Cult formations with 2+ in Initiative Rating receive a +1 modifier to the dice roll when attempting to make an Engage action or when rolling to rally in the End Phase.

rules.title: Brood Brothers
description: As long as a formation contains one Genestealer Patriarch, Genestealer Primus, Genestealer Magus, or Hybrid Iconward, units in in the same formation with the 'Brood Brother' special rule do not cause Blast Markers when they are destroyed, or when hit by a weapon with the 'Disrupt' special rule. This includes the extra Blast Marker from the first casualty of a crossfire and for units destroyed for being out of formation after a move. Units with 'Brood Brother' that are killed in an assault count for the purposes of working out its result.

rules.title: Broodcoven
description: The army must include a Broodcoven formation. The enemy counts as having achieved the ‘Break Their Spirit’ (BTS) victory condition if they destroy this formation or the most expensive formation in the army.
